Author: linedryonly
Text: Really solid response. BMI is an occasionally useful but overall problematic metric. It's important to take age and body composition in to account when calculating maintenance calories.

Author: mimedianaranja
Text: Look for a calorie calculator that takes your age and activity level into account- those both play a huge role in the number of calories you need for maintenance. I used this one- https://www.calculator.net/calorie-calculator.html  BMI isnâ€™t a great indicator for caloric needs, or health in general. Try and remember that every body is different and has different needs.
